item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Not knowing everything is all that makes it OK, sometimes... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Only the phoenix rises and does not descend. And everything changes. And nothing is truly lost." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I have always felt that violence was the last refuge of the incompetent, and empty threats the last sanctuary of the terminally inept." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Each person who ever was or is or will be has a song. It isn't a song that anybody else wrote. It has its own melody, it has its own words. Very few people get to sing their song. Most of us fear that we cannot do it justice with our voices, or that our words are too foolish or too honest, or too odd. So people live their song instead." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes we can choose the paths we follow. Sometimes our choices are made for us. And sometimes we have no choice at all." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There are only two worlds - your world, which is the real world, and other worlds, the fantasy. Worlds like this are worlds of the human imagination: their reality, or lack of reality, is not important. What is important is that they are there. these worlds provide an alternative. Provide an escape. Provide a threat. Provide a dream, and power; provide refuge, and pain. They give your world meaning. They do not exist; and thus they are all that matters. " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What power would hell have if those imprisoned here would not be able to dream of heaven?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It is a fool's prerogative to utter truths that no one else will speak." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "She said we all not only could know everything. We do. We just tell ourselves we don't to make it all bearable." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Go then, there are other worlds than these." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Humor is almost always anger with its make-up on." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "It is the tale, not he who tells it." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Sometimes human places, create inhuman monsters." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A tragedy is a tragedy, and at the bottom, all tragedies are stupid. Give me a choice and I'll take <i>A Midsummer Night's Dream</i> over <i>Hamlet</i> every time. Any fool with steady hands and a working set of lungs can build up a house of cards and then blow it down, but it takes a genius to make people laugh." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "But still, sometimes, in the heart of winter when the light outside seemed yellow- sleepy, like a cat curled up on a sofa..." -- Stephen King
